text: <@U6W3H6YN8> Thank you for the heads up, currently we are not using Multi-language content from HubSpot, there are actual really separate pages and sub-domains, I think eventually they will move to that route but there was a lot of political red tape about process and management of content, so they kept it all separate, we will look into this language switcher module when we are ready for that.

I'm stumped. We have a video library created (<https://info.marymount.edu/video-library?design>) that lets you add a parameter to load a specific video by default in the main section. clicking on that link will load the correct video thumbnail and src URL, but when you play or if you download the video, it will use a different video, even though the src URL is correct (and different). Does anyone know why this might be happening? All the video thumbnails and src URLS are being changed using JS and HubL
you’re going to have to post your code in a snippet I think
it seems to be working fine for me, when i clicked for turtle video, it plays the same, and the elements are changing on click properly.

so it will work after you click it, it just won't work when you initially load. Since this is the design paramter, you should just be able to click play on the main video and play the design video, but when you do, it plays the wrong video
okay let me check this way

not sure if i'm checking it wrong, but i loaded the page, and clicked on play on the main video, and this video loads <https://info.marymount.edu/hubfs/Videos%20LP/Design-a-thon%20Interior%20Design.mp4>
hm, it seems to only work in IE

New tutorial alert! :rotating_light:

This article details best practices to ensure that any custom JS/CSS in templates play nice with the CMS editor:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/how-to-make-custom-code-work-with-cms>

i want to use some javascript to change around our 'manage preferences' page beyond what we can do by changing the header/footer in the template. for example we're looking to add logos for subscription types, etc. my question is, are we violating any sort of rules by doing so? i figure there's a reason we can't do much with our list of subscription types beyond designating where in a template we want them listed

I don’t think there are any “rules” per say. I’d just be careful to make sure your javascript wont mess with any javascript HubSpot might be using there, and you should be fine.

I think the reason that it’s currently a little inflexible is just because when they originally built it they wanted to be able to manage as much of it as they could on their end. for can spam, and the new privacy laws.

Biggest area that will get you into trouble is if you start hiding subscriptions options via your JS since not allowing to opt-out of a type of email that they just received is a big no-no.  Otherwise if you are just change looking and feel around, you should be good to go

right well i plan on detecting which sub type's email they're coming from (via the ID on the input that has the `highlighted-subscription` class) and then going from there. we use the same HS portal for 2 very distinct brands, and at the very least I hope to separate the two, if not hide the other brand's sub types completely. if i can't figure the highlighted sub, i'll just show them all
thanks, both of you, for your time and input
